page.title: 14Education
page.content: Children under four can go to a playgroup run by mothers and up to the age of five can go to nursery in the area. The area is served by two primary schools. Both are open plan, which means that there are no separating walls between classes and they share library and art areas. Seven age groups are taught in each school. Most of the staff live locally and children come from Wormit, Newport and rural areas nearby. Children are bused about 14 km to St. Andrews for their Secondary Education unless they attend a private school, usually in Dundee across the River Tay. Further Education is also available nearby in St. Andrews and Dundee.
